title: Japanese Chapter 7 Quiz: Essential Verbs & Conjugation Basics

questions.question: What does いく mean?
questions.explanation: いく (iku) means "to go" in Japanese.

questions.question: What does たべる mean?
questions.explanation: たべる (taberu) means "to eat" in Japanese.

questions.question: What does する mean?
questions.explanation: する (suru) means "to do" in Japanese.

questions.question: What does くる mean?
questions.explanation: くる (kuru) means "to come" in Japanese.

questions.question: What does わたしはがっこうにいきます mean?
questions.explanation: わたしはがっこうにいきます (watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu) means "I go to school."

questions.question: Form the Japanese sentence "I eat bread"
questions.explanation: This is the polite form of "to eat" using 食べます (tabemasu).

questions.question: What does パンをたべません mean?
questions.explanation: パンをたべません (pan wo tabemasen) is the negative form meaning "I don't eat bread."

questions.question: What is the polite form of いく (to go)?
questions.explanation: いきます (ikimasu) is the polite present/future form of いく (iku).

questions.question: Form the Japanese sentence "I don't go to school"
questions.explanation: This is the negative polite form using 行きません (ikimasen).
questions.correctAnswer: 私は学校に行きません

questions.question: What is the negative form of たべる (to eat)?
questions.explanation: たべません (tabemasen) is the polite negative form of たべる (taberu).
